reviews.review_msg: If you're hesitating about your business major - take this course. Could be your turning point to true happiness. After taking BUS303 I finally realized how much I HATE business and all those waste-of-money classes like bus303. I've quit Beedie and I'm sooo happy I'm not gonna do any of the useless things anymore. Only design now, only real stuff.

Hope you like writing reflections because that's pretty much the entire course. Tom is a nice person however his class is not organized well. There is no clear syllabus or anything that shows what will be taught. He also makes online quizzes that only becomes available a few hours before class.

This guy had the hardest, most difficult quizzes. I walked into the course with an open mind, thinking that "Business Ethics" could actually be something to consider. However, the abysmal teaching methodology this nut bar follows has allowed me to conclude that business ethics is a waste of knowledge.

Incredible. Tom's methodology is different from most profs at SFU-his classes are all based on synthesis and understanding, not simple regurgitation. A lot of the negative comments on here come from students who are used to memorizing a textbook for an A. Tom makes you think and understand, and does it with a minimal workload. Simply a great prof.

Great teacher who is passionate about his subject, and provides useful assignments to emphasize course material. He is approachable and helpful with student questions. I would definitely take this class with him!
Such a bad proof! dont take it with him! so many assingments! avoid this class with this prof! take it with korth!
Great professor! learned alot and its one of those lecture you can just sit back and enjoy. Very understanding person and accomodating! i recommend this prof

Marks ridiculously hard!!! On every little thing!!! Inconsistent with his expectations. Million little assignments. Too bad it's a mandatory class for business students. Do not suggest taking it with him take it with someone else
